task.Question:
Hi, I was out sick from my classes on Friday, so I'm trying to figure out what I need to study for my Calculus mid-term next week. My friend from class sent me an audio recording of Professor Willowbrook giving out the recommended reading for the test, but my headphones are broken :(

Could you please listen to the recording for me and tell me the page numbers I'm supposed to go over? I've attached a file called Homework.mp3 that has the recording. Please provide just the page numbers as a comma-delimited list. And please provide the list in ascending order.

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
Step 1: Load the file supplied by my user.
Step 2: Using audio processing tools, convert the text of the audio file to speech:

"Before you all go, I want to remind you that the midterm is next week. Here's a little hint; you should be familiar with the differential equations on page 245, problems that are very similar to problems 32, 33, and 44 from that page might be on the test. And also some of you might want to brush up on the last page in the integration section, page 197. I know some of you struggled on last week's quiz. I foresee problem 22 from page 197 being on your midterm. Oh, and don't forget to brush up on the section on related rates, on pages 132, 133, and 134."

Step 3: Evaluate the converted audio, recording each instance of page numbers: 245, 197, 197, 132, 133, 134
Step 4: Sort the page numbers in ascending order, omitting duplicates, and store this list as the correct answer to my user's request: 132, 133, 134, 197, 245
Step 5: Report the correct response to my user: "132, 133, 134, 197, 245"
Annotator Metadata.Tools:
1. A file interface
2. A speech-to-text audio processing tool

steps.content:
Hi, I was out sick from my classes on Friday, so I'm trying to figure out what I need to study for my Calculus mid-term next week. My friend from class sent me an audio recording of Professor Willowbrook giving out the recommended reading for the test, but my headphones are broken :(

Could you please listen to the recording for me and tell me the page numbers I'm supposed to go over? I've attached a file called Homework.mp3 that has the recording. Please provide just the page numbers as a comma-delimited list. And please provide the list in ascending order.

MP3 document content:
### Audio Transcript:
Before you all go, I want to remind you that the midterm is next week. Here's a little hint. You should be familiar with the differential equations on page 245. Problems that are very similar to problems 32, 33 and 44 from that page might be on the test. And also some of you might want to brush up on the last page in the integration section, page 197. I know some of you struggled on last week's quiz. I foresee problem 22 from page 197 being on your midterm. Oh and don't forget to brush up on the section on related rates on pages 132, 133 and 134.

Path to the mentioned document: /tmp/1f975693-876d-457b-a649-393859e79bf3.mp3

plan: Extract the relevant information from the provided audio transcript regarding the recommended reading for the Calculus mid-term.
Identify the specific page numbers mentioned in the transcript.
Compile the page numbers into a list.
Sort the list of page numbers in ascending order.
Format the list as a comma-delimited string.

given_facts: Recommended reading includes differential equations on page 245.
Problems similar to problems 32, 33, and 44 from page 245 might be on the test.
The last page in the integration section is page 197.
Problem 22 from page 197 might be on the midterm.
The section on related rates is on pages 132, 133, and 134.

steps.fact_description: page numbers recommended for the Calculus mid-term
steps.quote_with_fact: You should be familiar with the differential equations on page 245. ... brush up on the last page in the integration section, page 197. ... brush up on the section on related rates on pages 132, 133 and 134.

reasoning: The recommended page numbers extracted from the audio transcript are 132, 133, 134, 197, and 245.
These page numbers need to be sorted in ascending order.
The final output should be a comma-delimited list of these page numbers.

steps.overview: Extracted and sorted the recommended page numbers for the Calculus mid-term.
